item.title: Errors ! help please!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

smerf45:

alright good point lol ill update it right now. but as for the javac thing ?? can ya help me out on that please !!

Javac is what turns your source files into class files (A file that is readable by the Java console, which is what is behind the whole operation). It’s in all JDK’s. All you have to do is use javac to encrypt your source files. Should be an easy batch command.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors ! help please!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Shop prices do not require compiling because they are read straight from the server and there is no encryption needed. Compiling is just encrypting the “.java” files into a file “.class” that the Java console can understand. Make sure you have the Java Development Kit installed and you are applying javac to your source files.

Read full topic

item.title: Errors ! help please!
item.dc:creator: @smerf45 smerf45
item.description:
@smerf45 wrote:

ok i started by changing all the startup screens and commands and the welcome screen dialogue to my servers name and all that good stuff. when i save it and compile it and restart the server it all still says the name of the old server. but when i go into my client.java all of it says my server name ??? idk whats going on and why it wont work please help me !!!

here is my compiler code also. i know my paths are set right because i changed shop prices

@echo off @TITLE Digital Dogs if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
